entry.title: Using Windows VM in Linux Mint I3wm
entry.content:
Build a Windows vm in VirtualBox.

Then get the UUID of the guest OS with:

$ VBoxManage list vms
"Win7Office" {35cd049b-7242-4db4-8329-2eb05149f5cf}
...

The UUID will be used to start the vm with script. Save the following line in /usr/local/bin/win7:

VBoxManage startvm 35cd049b-7242-4db4-8329-2eb05149f5cf --type gui

Add executing permission: sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/win7;

Now start Windows vm with dmenu: Alt-d -> win7.

Make the vm full screen: press “Home” key, (here is right ctrl key), followed by Alt-f.

To leave the guest system to the #2 workspace: right Ctrl, Alt-2.

entry.title: Connect Windows Remote Desktop From Linux Mint
entry.content:
On Windows server, check “Allow connections only from computers running Remote Desktop with Network Level Authentication (more secure).” in Remote desktop settings.

On client, run sudo aptitude install remmina freerdp-x11 remmina-plugin-rdp.

Start Remmina, create a new connection, the “Server” is the IP address, “User name” and “Password” is the Windows account name and password. Leave “Domain” blank, and set “Color depth” to “True color (24bpp)”. Set “Resolution” to “Use client resolution”. And click “Connect” button.

entry.title: Remove Linux From a Windows-Linux Dual-booting Computer
entry.content:
I installed Linux Mint on Thinkpad T440p laptop. Now I need to remove the Linux from this computer.

  1. Download mbrfix.zip from “Download” channel on sysint.no.

  2. Login the Windows on the laptop, unzip mbrfix.zip, copy MbrFix.exe to C drive;

  3. Open a console as administrator, run MbrFix /drive 0 fixmbr /win7 /yes;

  4. Format Linux partition;

Reboot, bingo.

entry.title: Build C Development Environment With VirtualBox
entry.content:
Host: Win7, VM: CentOS 6.5 minimal

VM setup

setup network and share folders in Settings of VM.

Network setup

  1. In settings of VM: the first NIC is host-only, second is bridged.

  2. Start VM, create /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth1 based on ifcfg-eth0, the hardware address is from /etc/udev/rules/70-persistent.network;

  3. reboot;

Install Guest Addons

In VM:

 # yum update
 # yum install gcc
 # yum install kernel-devel
 # mount /dev/scd0 /media/cdrom
 # sh /media/VBOXADDITIONS_4.0.12_72916/VBoxLinuxAdditions.run

Now you can visit share folders in /media/sf_.

entry.title: Windows and CentOS Dual Boot on PC
entry.content:
1. Install Windows 7;

  2. Install CentOS 6.4, choose “Basic Storage Devices -> … -> Create Custom Layout”, delete extended partition, create a root partition and a swap partition for CentOS;

  3. Verify the startup list;

  4. After installation of CentOS, login the system, you can edit /boot/grub/menu.lst to modify defaut startup system, default timeout, etc.

  5. During system startup, press up/down key before countdown over to activate the system boot menu to choose Windows or CentOS for startup.

That’s it.
